file_content.text: Leave us, outlander.
I'm looking for the remains of a ship called the Starrunner, which you took from the distress beacon site.
Who are you? Must you outlanders claim every slab of ice on Hoth?
Drive this stranger away! Hound her through the snow until she squeals!
Drive this stranger away! Hound him through the snow until he squeals!
You will do no such thing!
The master speaks!
I'm Horak-Mul, right hand of Ludo Kressh, the true Dark Lord of the Sith. Or what's left of him.
It is truly an honor to meet one such as yourself.
I bow before you, my lord.
Don't bow to this animal! When I am returned to my true and terrible form, then you will bow.
Wait. Who?
Do not play stupid with me. I am Horak-Mul, Sith Lord that was.
You're an Ortolan chief, and I will kill you. Tell me where the Starrunner is!
Don't play games with me.
The Starrunner! I crashed that ship into the surface of Hoth and drove its crew to ruin!
Looks like we've found our ghost. So you want me to pop this blue thing in the skull so you can bind this guy?
He speaks of Sith Lords long dead. We have found our ghostly quarry, my master.
No offense, but master... why can't you Sith just become one with the Force when you die?
I know what you are, Force caller. Your last victim writhes within your mind. But I will not be bound!
Surely I can persuade you otherwise? I've never taken "no" for an answer, and it would be a shame to start now.
There must be some way....
Do you really think you can challenge me?
If you'd rather speak through these idiots for eternity, be my guest.
You think you scare me?
You think you are more worthy than these animals?
I will release you when I've defeated my enemy.
It's only for a short time.
Is that all I am to you, Sith? A tool? A weapon?
It took five of Naga Sadow's assassins to kill me! Not one, but five!
I hold my freedom dear, Sith. If you wish to bind me, it will take more than words.
I do no one's bidding but my own.
Do you take me for a slave?
Then you will not get what you want. But if you should reconsider, look for a temple buried in the snows of Hoth.
I'm listening.
I wonder if Jedi have this much trouble getting what they want.
There's always something.
Buried deep in the snows of Hoth, you will find the ruins of an ancient Sith temple.
The temple was both training ground and burial site for Naga Sadow's personal order of assassins. The assassins who murdered me.
Become the instrument of my revenge, and I will consider divulging my location and sharing my strength.
Consideration is not enough. I want your word.
You will promise.
My consideration is all you'll get.
And how exactly do I enact revenge on ancient dead assassins?
Could you be more specific?
Do what it seems you do best. Destroy.
Why not have these creatures do it for you?
Get the Ortolans to do it.
The temple is lined with complicated traps, and these animals have no talent for thinking. I hope you're different, but I won't mourn you.
Desecrate the temple. Destroy every relic, every bone, every ornate bauble. Then we may talk again.
The master has spoken. Leave us, outlander.
What is this? Go away.
